title: Cape Lookout National Seashore: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar            Calendar           Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 3 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Cape Lookout National Seashore Evening at the Cape      Location: Harkers Island, NC Fees: $28 per person (includes ferry cost)     Thursday, August 18, 2016 Experience the Cape Lookout Lighthouse and island as the Lighthouse Keepers did, in the dark of the night. View Details      Cape Lookout National Seashore Naturalist Exploration of Shackleford Banks      Time: 9:30 AM to 12:00 PM Location: Beaufort, NC Fees: ferry fee charged, no charge for ranger program     Friday, August 26, 2016 Join a Ranger for an exploration of the dunes, marshes, mud flats, and the ocean on Shackleford Banks! View Details      Cape Lookout National Seashore Beach Birding with a Side of Horses      Time: 9:30 AM to 12:00 PM Location: Beaufort, NC Fees: Ferry fee, no charge for ranger-guided program     Sunday, August 28, 2016 Come for a walk on the wild-side with a Ranger to discover what birds are flying and where the horses are hiding on Shackleford Banks View Details             Special Event Programs  Horse Sense & Survival Walking Tours Join a Ranger for a half-day walking trip to find the wild horses of Shackleford Banks and watch their behavior. There is a fee for the ferry service. Call (252) 728-2250 ext. 0 for reservations and more information.  An Evening at the Cape Bring your flashlight and experience the Cape Lookout Lighthouse and nearby beaches as the Lighthouse Keepers did at the start of their work "day", in the dark. These special climbs are scheduled near the full moon of each month from May through September.  There is a fee which includes the price of tickets for the lighthouse and the ferry cost.  Portsmouth Homecoming A gathering of family, neighbors, friends and soon-to-be friends.  Come join us for this bi-annual gathering in the village of Portsmouth.   Happy Anniversary! The park is 50 years old & the National Park Service is 100 years old this year.  Come join us on June 18th as we celebrate these milestone anniversaries.
